title: Mozart, The Man and the Artist as Revealed  in His Own Words
creator: Friedrich Kerst
description: Librivox recording of Mozart, The Man and the Artist Revealed in His Own Words by Friedrich Kerst. Translated by Henry Edward Krehbiel. Read by Aaron Elliott, Laurie Anne Waldon, DrBeccaAnne, Tom Crawford & Sibella Denton. Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart. His name is one of the most recognizable names in history and one of the most enduring of composers. At age 5, this “wunderkinder” took to the stage and began his life as a prolific and celebrated creator-genius of such luminous works the world has not known since. This collection of morsels taken from his personal letters is engaging and gives a look into the mind of the boy wonder. Was he mad? Was he miraculous? (Summary by Aaron Elliott) For more free audiobooks, or to become a volunteer reader, please visit librivox.org. M4B format available
subject: librivox; audiobooks; Mozart; quotations; composers; music; letters
source: Librivox recording of a public-domain text
